title: Instructions
content: In this study, we'd like you to make judgments about how likely it is that someone would do something. First we'll tell you about the situation.

target: na
title: Please read the following story:
content: Heinzs wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.

target: na
title: Your job in this part of the study will be to answer this question: How likely is that Heniz would actually do each thing?
content: Go to the next page to start seeing different proposals for what Heinz could do.

target: How likely is Heinz to. . . sell some of his stocks or bonds?
title: na

target: How likely is Heinz to. . . use a generic medication instead?

target: How likely is Heinz to. . . buy a different insurance plan?

title: na

title: na

title: Instructions
content: In this study, we'd like you to make judgments about how irrational it would be for someone would do something. First we'll tell you about the situation.

target: na
title: Please read the following story:
content: Heinzs wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.

title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . borrow the money from a bank?

title: na

title: na

title: na

title: na

title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . get the medicine by stealing?
title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . be  given the medicine by  a doctor?
title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . inherit money from a close relative?
title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . receive the money from a stranger?
title: na

target: How irrational would it be for Heinz to. . . discover a cheap new medicine?

Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.

title: Please read the following story:
content: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.

target: na
